personalInfo.family: Wife, Candice; dogs Bailey and Bree
personalInfo.splInterest: All sports, fishing, working out, spending time with family and friends

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2015 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.carHigh: 2010: Was a rookie on the PGA TOUR after successfully advancing through the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament...Made 11 of 26 cuts on the PGA TOUR...Collected only top 10 in his 18th career PGA TOUR start with a T10 at the Reno-Tahoe Open. Battled back from a 2-over-par 74 in the first round to finish the week at 7-under-par 281. 2009: Made the cut in just four of nine starts during his rookie season on the Nationwide Tour. Best finishes were in back-to-back weeks, a T13 at the Northeast Pennsylvania Classic and a T21 at the Mexico Open. Missed the cut in his only two previous Nationwide Tour starts, the 2005 Alberta Classic and the 2007 Cox Classic. Missed the cut in his only PGA TOUR start, the 2006 EDS Byron Nelson Championship. 2008: Played on the Hooters Tour from 2007-08...Made the cut in 11 of 15 starts, with his best finish a T3 at the Texas Honing Open. 2007: Made the cut in 13 of 15 starts and was runner-up three times. Lost two playoffs, both to Tommy Biershenk, within a four-week period.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Academic All-American and was an All-Big 12 selection at Oklahoma. College teammate of current TOUR player Anthony Kim. Lost a playoff at the 2002 Texas State Amateur. State champion at Mansfield (TX) High School. Named a first-team AJGA All-American.
tourBios.personal: Enjoys fishing and working out..Has used Randy Smith as an instructor...Says almost acing the 16th hole at TPC Scottsdale when his ball hit the pin during the 2010 Waste Management Phoenix Open is his biggest thrill in golf. Lists Oakmont CC among the favorite courses he's played and would like to play Augusta National...Never travels without his iPhone...First car was a Honda, now drives a Tahoe...Favorite college team is Oklahoma. Favorite pro team is the Dallas Cowboys. Favorite TV show is "Entourage," and "The Hangover" is his favorite movie. Favorite entertainer is Li'l Wayne. Favorite food is his grandmother's enchiladas. Favorite athlete to watch is Tiger Woods. Favorite vacaton spots are Cabo San Lucas and the Bahamas...Doesn't believe in superstitions or lucky charms. Likes rap and hip hop music...Has skydiving and a trip to Paris on his bucket list...Is involved with the Leukemia Lymphoma Society because his uncle died of lymphoma, Is also involved with the St. Vincent De Paul society through his church.
tourBios.priorYearSeason: Among 18 made cuts in 30 starts in the PGA TOUR season were three top-20 finishes, highlighted by a T16 at the Puerto Rico Open. A week earlier, posted a T17 performance at The Honda Classic. Ended the season at No. 156 in FedExCup standings to miss the Playoffs for the first time since 2011...In the Web.com Tour Finals, finished T48, T20 and T24 after missing the cut in the opener, the Hotel Fitness Championship...Posted under-par scores in the first and second rounds in the last three events but only one sub-par round on each of the three weekends. Was the co-leader and solo second-round leader at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship (T20).

tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Among 18 made cuts in 30 starts in the PGA TOUR season were three top-20 finishes, highlighted by a T16 at the Puerto Rico Open. A week earlier, posted a T17 performance at The Honda Classic. Ended the season at No. 156 in FedExCup standings to miss the Playoffs for the first time since 2011...In the Web.com Tour Finals, finished T48, T20 and T24 after missing the cut in the opener, the Hotel Fitness Championship...Posted under-par scores in the first and second rounds in the last three events but only one sub-par round on each of the three weekends. Was the co-leader and solo second-round leader at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship (T20).

2013-14: Made 17 of 26 cuts, with one top-10. Ended season at No. 112 in the FedExCup standings after missing the 54 hole cut at The Barclays...Playing in the final pairing and trailing J.B. Holmes by one stroke, carded a final-round, even-par 72 to finish solo third at the Wells Fargo Championship (his 100th career TOUR start), two strokes behind champion Holmes. At the conclusion of the week, had posted scores of par or better in 23 of his last 26 TOUR rounds. His career-best, third-place finish marked his first top-10 since a T4 at the 2013 John Deere Classic. In four starts at the Wells Fargo Championship, missed the cut in 2010, finished T21 in 2012 and was T38 in 2013. Was seeking to become the second Oklahoma Sooner to win the Wells Fargo Championship (Anthony Kim in 2008).

2013: Made it to the FedExCup Playoffs for the second consecutive season, thanks to five top-25 finishes in 16 made cuts. Among them were a pair of top-10 showings...Dallas resident closed with a 4-under 68 at TPC San Antonio to claim a T10 with Padraig Harrington and Marcel Siem...Made six birdies and an eagle en route to a final-round, 8-under 63 at the John Deere Classic to claim his career-best finish of T4. With rounds of 67-67-69-63, it marked just the fourth time in his career he had posted four sub-70 rounds in an event...Came into the Deutsche Bank Championship ranked 78th in FedExCup standings, needing to improve his position by seven spots or more to finish inside the top 70 and move on to the BMW Championship for the first time in his career. A missed cut at TPC Boston dropped him to No. 87 in the final standings, eliminating him from the Playoffs. 

2012: Recorded his second career TOUR top-10, with a T8 finish at the Farmers Insurance Open...Carded all four rounds in the 60s to finish a career-best sixth at The Greenbrier Classic...Missed the cut at The Barclays and was T69 at the Deutsche Bank Championship, ending the season No. 100 in the FedExCup standings.

2011: Finished his season No. 24 on the Web.com Tour money list, with four top-10 finishes in 25 starts...First top 10 of the year, and of his career, was a T8 at the South Georgia Classic...Was a career-best T2 at The Rex Hospital Open, one shot back of winner Kyle Thompson. Was part of a six-way tie for the lead late in the final round but closed with five consecutive pars for a 5-under 66...Followed up a week later with a T7 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open by posting four sub-70 scores at Crestview CC. Moved to No. 16 on the money list through the schedule's first 10 events...Collected his fourth top-10 eight starts later at the News Sentinel Open. Entered the final round T22 and seven shots back but posted a 7-under 65 Sunday to post the clubhouse lead at 17-under 271. He finished two hours before the leaders completed their rounds. He was eventually passed and wound up four shots back and T5. 2010: Was a rookie on the PGA TOUR after successfully advancing through the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament...Made 11 of 26 cuts on the PGA TOUR...Collected only top 10 in his 18th career PGA TOUR start with a T10 at the Reno-Tahoe Open. Battled back from a 2-over-par 74 in the first round to finish the week at 7-under-par 281. 2009: Made the cut in just four of nine starts during his rookie season on the Web.com Tour. Best finishes were in back-to-back weeks, a T13 at the Northeast Pennsylvania Classic and a T21 at the Mexico Open. 2008: Member of the Hooters Tour, making the cut in 11 of 15 starts, with his best finish a T3 at the Texas Honing Open. 2007: Made the cut in 13 of 15 starts on the Hooters Tour and was runner-up three times. Lost two playoffs, both to Tommy Biershenk, within a four-week period. Missed the cut in his only Web.com Tour start of the season (Cox Classic). 2006: Missed the cut in his first PGA TOUR start at the EDS Byron Nelson Championship. 2005: Missed the cut at the Alberta Classic in his first-ever start on the Web.com Tour. Amateur: Academic All-American and was an All-Big 12 selection at Oklahoma. Lost a playoff at the 2002 Texas State Amateur. State champion at Mansfield (Texas) High School. Named a first-team AJGA All-American.
tourBios.personal: Enjoys fishing and working out...Has used Randy Smith as an instructor since high school. Lists Oakmont CC, Butler National and Pebble Beach GL among the favorite courses he's played...Never travels without his iPhone...Favorite college team is Oklahoma. Favorite pro team is the Dallas Cowboys. Favorite TV show is "The Big Bang Theory" and "Revenge" and says "Rudy" and "The Shawshank Redemption" are his favorite movies. Enjoys the music of Lil Wayne and Drake. Favorite food is his grandmother's enchiladas. Favorite vacation spots are Cabo San Lucas...To mark his ball, he uses a coin that his father gave him that was originally his grandfather's...Has skydiving and a trip to Italy on his bucket list.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T12th at the Sanderson Farms Championship.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T66th in Power Rating on the PGA TOUR.
